sen.j: 橿原市（かしはらし）は、奈良県中部の市。
sen.e: Kashihara City (橿原市) is located on the middle part of Nara Prefecture.
Kashihara City is located in the central part of Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、on the middle part of→in the central part ofとしました。
sen.e: Kashihara City is located in the central part of Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 総人口約125,000人と、奈良市に次ぐ県下第二の都市である。
sen.e: The total population is approx. 125,000, and it is the second biggest city to Nara city on Nara Prefecture.
The total population is approx. 125,000, and it is the second biggest city after Nara City in Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: to Nara city→after Nara City、on Nara Prefecture→in Nara Prefectureとしました。
sen.e: The total population is approx. 125,000, and it is the second biggest city after Nara City in Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 市名は「神武天皇橿原の宮」に由来する。
sen.e: The city was named after 'the Kashihara Imperial Palace (橿原の宮)' owned by Emperor Jinmu.
The city was named after 'the Kashihara Imperial Palace' owned by Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: The city was named after 'the Kashihara Imperial Palace' owned by Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 近鉄大阪線でつながっていることもあり、大阪府柏原市（かしわらし）と混同されることが結構ある。
sen.e: Kashihara City (橿原市) is often mixed up with Kashiwabara City (柏原市), Osaka Prefecture, because they are connected by the Kintetsu Osaka Line.
Kashihara City is often mixed up with Kashiwara City, Osaka Prefecture, because they are connected by the Kintetsu Osaka Line.
Kashihara City is often mixed up with Kashiwara City, Osaka Prefecture, because they are connected by the Kintetsu Osaka Line.

sen.j: そのため、電話など口頭で『かしはら』と言う場合に、相手が大阪の柏原と勘違いしないように、『やまとかしはら』と言うことがある。
sen.e: One sometimes calls Kashihara City (橿原市), "Ymatokashihara" instead of just "Kashihara" in conversations like phone conversations, for other parties to not to mix up with Kashiwabara City (柏原市), located on Osaka Prefecture.

One sometimes calls Kashihara City, "Ymatokashihara" instead of just "Kashihara" in conversations like phone conversations, for other parties not to mix up with Kashiwara City, located in Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、to not to mix up→not to mix up、Kashiwabara→Kashiwaraに修正、全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、on Osaka Prefecture→in Osaka Prefectureとしました。
sen.e: One sometimes calls Kashihara City, "Ymatokashihara" instead of just "Kashihara" in conversations like phone conversations, for other parties not to mix up with Kashiwara City, located in Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 市域のほとんどは平坦地であるが、畝傍山・天香具山・耳成山の大和三山が優美な姿を見せる。
sen.e: Most of the city area is plain land, and the elegant figures of the Three Mountains of Yamato (大和三山), Mt. Unebi (畝傍山), Mt. Amano Kaguyama (天香具山) and Mt. Miminashi (耳成山), are seen.
Most of the city area is plain land, and the elegant figures of the Three Mountains of Yamato, Mt. Unebi, Mt. Amano Kaguyama and Mt. Miminashi, are seen.
Most of the city area is plain land, and the elegant figures of the Three Mountains of Yamato, Mt. Unebi, Mt. Amano Kaguyama and Mt. Miminashi, are seen.

sen.j: 夏暑く、冬は寒い、また雨が少ない盆地特有の内陸性の気候である。
sen.e: It has inland weather, hot in summer, cold in winter and little rain, typical of a basin.
It has an inland climate, hot in summer, cold in winter and little rain, typical of a basin.
sen.cmt: inland weather→an inland climateとしました。
sen.e: It has an inland climate, hot in summer, cold in winter and little rain, typical of a basin.

sen.j: 奈良県統計
sen.e: Statistics by Nara Prefecture
Statistics by Nara Prefecture
Statistics by Nara Prefecture
As of October 1, 2007, the population is 124,631.
As of October 1, 2007, the population is 124,631.
As of October 1, 2007, the population is 124,631.
The growth rate of population from 2002 to 2007 is -0.8 %.
The growth rate of population from 2002 to 2007 is -0.8 %.
The growth rate of population from 2002 to 2007 is -0.8 %.

sen.j: 古代の大和国高市郡遊部（あそべ）郷・久米（くめ）郷・雲梯（うなて）郷、十市郡神戸（かむと）郷の地であり、久米御県神社・畝火山口坐神社・川俣神社・高市御県神社・天太玉命神社・宗我坐宗我都比古神社など数多くの延喜式内社が鎮座する。
sen.e: Asobe-go (遊部(あそべ)郷), Kume-go (久米(くめ)郷), Unate-go (雲梯(うなて)郷), Takaichi-gun, Yamato Province (大和国高市郡), and Kamuto-go (神戸(かむと)郷), Toichi-gun (十市郡) used to be there in antiquity, and there are many Engishikinaisha (延喜式内社) such as Kume no miagata jinja shrine (久米御県神社), Unebi yamaguchi ni imasu jinja shrine (畝火山口坐神社), Kawamata jinja shrine (川俣神社), Takeichi miagata jinja shrine (高市御県神社), Futotamanomikoto-jinja Shrine (太玉命神社), Sogani imasu sogatsuhiko jinja shrine (宗我坐宗我都比古神社).

Asobe-go, Kume-go, Unate-go, Takaichi County, Yamato Province, and Kamuto-go, Toichi County used to be there in antiquity, and there are many Engishikinaisha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws) such as Kume no miagata-jinja Shrine, Unebi yamaguchi ni imasu-jinja Shrine, Kawamata-jinja Shrine, Takechi no miagata-jinja Shrine, Ame no futotamanomikoto-jinja Shrine, Sogani imasu sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、-gun→County、神社名を-jinja Shrineの表記に修正、Takeichi miagata→Takechi no miagata、Futotamanomikoto→Ame no futotomanomikotoに修正 (参照: http://www.genbu.net/place/indexkansai.htm)、Engishikinaishaの補足追加
sen.e: Asobe-go, Kume-go, Unate-go, Takaichi County, Yamato Province, and Kamuto-go, Toichi County used to be there in antiquity, and there are many Engishikinaisha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws) such as Kume no miagata-jinja Shrine, Unebi yamaguchi ni imasu-jinja Shrine, Kawamata-jinja Shrine, Takechi no miagata-jinja Shrine, Ame no futotamanomikoto-jinja Shrine, Sogani imasu sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 694年に日本最初の都城である藤原京が造営され、都が平城京に移転するまで16年存続した。
sen.e: Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace), the first capital of Japan, was built in 694 and had existed for 16 years until the capital was transferred to Heijo-kyo.
Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace), the first capital of Japan, was built in 694 and had existed for 16 years until the capital was transferred to Heijo-kyo.
Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace), the first capital of Japan, was built in 694 and had existed for 16 years until the capital was transferred to Heijo-kyo.

sen.j: 中世には寺内町である今井町が自治都市として発展した。
sen.e: In medieval times, Imai-cho (今井町) as Jinai-cho (寺内町) (temple villages) was developed as an autonomous city.
In medieval times, Imai-cho as Jinai-cho (temple villages) was developed as an autonomous city.
In medieval times, Imai-cho as Jinai-cho (temple villages) was developed as an autonomous city.

sen.j: 幕末から神武天皇建国の地として注目され、畝傍陵が造営され、また明治期には官幣大社・橿原神宮も創建された。
sen.e: This site has attracted the attention of people since the end of the Edo period as a place where Emperor Jinmu (神武天皇) found a nation, and the Unebi Mausoleum (畝傍陵) was built there; in the end of the Meiji period Kashihara-jingu Shrine (橿原神宮), Kanpei-taisha (官幣大社) (large-scale state shrine), was also buiit.

This site has attracted the attention of people since the end of the Edo period as a place where Emperor Jinmu found a nation, and the Unebi Mausoleum was built there; in the Meiji period Kashihara-jingu Shrine, Kanpei-taisha (large-scale state shrine), was also buiit.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、「明治期」とあるため、in the end of the Meiji period→in the Meiji periodに修正
sen.e: This site has attracted the attention of people since the end of the Edo period as a place where Emperor Jinmu found a nation, and the Unebi Mausoleum was built there; in the Meiji period Kashihara-jingu Shrine, Kanpei-taisha (large-scale state shrine), was also buiit.

sen.j: 高度経済成長期には大阪市や京都市、奈良市などのベッドタウンとして人口流入が続いた。
sen.e: In the high economic growth period, the population inflow occured as a commuter town of Osaka City, Kyoto City and Nara City.
In the high economic growth period, the population inflow occured as a commuter town of Osaka City, Kyoto City and Nara City.
In the high economic growth period, the population inflow occured as a commuter town of Osaka City, Kyoto City and Nara City.
February 11, 1956:
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: February 11, 1956:

sen.j: 高市郡八木町・今井町・畝傍町・真菅村・鴨公村・磯城郡耳成村の合併によって市制施行。
sen.e: Yagi-cho (八木町), Imai-cho (今井町), Unebi-cho (畝傍町), Masuge village (真菅村), Kamogimi village (鴨公村), Takaichi-gun (高市郡), and Miminashi village (耳成村), Shiki-gun (磯城郡) were incorporated as Kashihara City.
Yagi-cho, Imai-cho, Unebi-cho, Masuge-mura, Kamogimi-mura, Takaichi County, and Miminashi-mura, Shiki County were incorporated as Kashihara City.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、Kamogimi-mura, Miminashi-muraとし、-gun→Countyとしました。
sen.e: Yagi-cho, Imai-cho, Unebi-cho, Masuge-mura, Kamogimi-mura, Takaichi County, and Miminashi-mura, Shiki County were incorporated as Kashihara City.

sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 高市郡金橋村・新沢村を編入。
sen.e: The city incorporated Kanahashi village (金橋村) and Shinzawa village (新沢村), Takaichi-gun.
The city incorporated Kanahashi-mura and Shinzawa-mura, Takaichi County.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、Kanahashi-mura、Shinzawa-mura、Takaichi Countyとしました。
sen.e: The city incorporated Kanahashi-mura and Shinzawa-mura, Takaichi County.

sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 磯城郡田原本町のうち、飯高・大垣・豊田・新口・西新堂の5大字を編入。
sen.e: The city incorporated the 5 major Aza (字) - Iitaka (飯高), Ogaki (大垣), Toyota (豊田), inokuchi (新口), and Nishi Shindo (西新堂), located in Tawaramoto-cho (田原本町), Shiki-gun (磯城郡).
The city incorporated the five major Aza - Iitaka, Ogaki, Toyota, Ninokuchi, and Nishi Shindo, located in Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki County.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記削除、5をスペルアウト、inokuchi→Ninokuchiに修正、Shiki Countyとしました。
sen.e: The city incorporated the five major Aza - Iitaka, Ogaki, Toyota, Ninokuchi, and Nishi Shindo, located in Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki County.

sen.j: 大和三山（畝傍山・耳成山・天香久山の三山を指す。2005年（平成17年）7月14日、国の名勝に指定。）
sen.e: 'Three Mountains of Yamato (大和三山),' designated a national site of scenic beauty on July 14, 2005, consists of Mt. Unebi (畝傍山), Mt. Amano Kaguyama (天香具山) and Mt. Miminashi (耳成山).
The Three Mountains of Yamato, designated a national site of scenic beauty on July 14, 2005, consists of Mt. Unebi, Mt. Amano Kaguyama and Mt. Miminashi.
